contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox character | colour = #DEDEE2 | colour text = | name = Fearless Leader | series = [[The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show|Rocky and His Friends]] | image = [[Image:boris natasha fearless.jpg|thumb|From left to right, Boris Badenov, Natasha Fatale, and Fearless Leader.]] | caption = | first = | last = | cause = | creator = [[Jay Ward]] | portrayer = | nickname = | alias = | species = | gender = Male | occupation = | title = | family = | spouse = | significantother = | children = | relatives = | portrayer = [[Robert De Niro]] | religion = | nationality = }} '''Fearless Leader''' is a fictional character and the principal antagonist in the 1959â€“1964 [[animated television series]] ''[[The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show|Rocky and His Friends]]'' and ''[[The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show|The Bullwinkle Show]]'', both shows often collectively referred to as ''[[The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show|Rocky and Bullwinkle]]''. He was voiced by [[Leon Askin]]. ==Character overview== Fearless Leader is the [[dictator]] of the [[fictional country]] [[Pottsylvania]], and the employer of the inept [[government agents]] [[Boris Badenov]] and [[Natasha Fatale]]. He could always be found in his underground hideout, "Central Control." However, it seems evident that he did answer to one man himself: the diminutive [[Mister Big (Rocky and Bullwinkle)|Mr. Big]]. Mr. Big appears in two storylines of the series, "Upsidaisium" and "Metal Munching Moon Mice." [[File:This Is The Enemy.jpg|200px|thumbnail|right|''This is the Enemy'' (Koehler/Ancona, 1942): possible basis for character appearance.]]As expected from his given position and name, Fearless Leader is a strict, ruthless character, and often harshly criticizes the incompetence of his main minion Boris. He is usually shown with a long scar on his cheek. He is distrustful of his own government employees, and is known to carry the Pottsylvania treasury with him wherever he goes. Although Pottsylvania's chief spies are given [[ersatz]] [[Russian language|Russian]] accents, Fearless Leader's accent seems more in keeping with the [[German people|German]] [[stereotype]]. In fact, his sharply-angled features closely resemble those from [http://web.archive.org/web/20110724155033/http://www.terraamericanart.org/dynamic/events/sb_events_image_1_1952.jpg an anti-Nazi propaganda poster] circulated during [[World War II]]. He uses some German such as "Achtung" and "Schweinhund." Thus, it has also been conjectured{{by whom|date=September 2012}} that he was modeled after Nazi Major Strasser in the 1942 movie "[[Casablanca_(film)|Casablanca]]". ==In other media== * Fearless Leader appears in two live-action films: he is portrayed by [[Christopher Neame]] in ''[[Boris and Natasha: The Movie]]'' (1992) and by [[Robert De Niro]] in ''[[The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle]]'' (2000). * Fearless Leader was also the background picture seen hanging on the wall in the old newspaper cartoon, "[[Grin and Bear It]]" by Lichty, whenever the [[Kremlin]] or [[politburo]] was being lampooned. * In [[Jamie Gilson]]'s book ''4B Goes Wild'', the strict, no-nonsense [[headmaster|headmistress]] of the elementary school is called that behind her back. When the [[protagonist]], Hobie Hanson, wins a lunch date with the headmistress in a [[raffle]], his friends tease him as to "When are you going to eat with Fearless Leader?" ==References== {{Reflist}} {{RockyAndBullwinkle}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fearless Leader}} [[Category:Rocky and Bullwinkle characters]] [[Category:Film characters]] [[Category:Fictional secret agents and spies]] [[Category:Fictional dictators]] [[Category:Fictional military personnel]] [[Category:Comedy film characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1959]] {{animation-char-stub}}
